Parnasala, Bhadrachalam:Why should you explore Temples in Hyderabad?Join our travel community for the latest tips, guides, and exclusive offers!Subscribe You have already subscribed our newsletter!Thanks for Subscribing our newsletter!You might find it fascinating that Hyderabad, often celebrated for its rich cultural heritage and bustling modernity, is also home to many magnificent temples.These temples, with their intricate architecture and deep-rooted history, offer a serene escape from the city’s hustle and bustle, inviting devotees and tourists alike to experience a blend of spirituality and tradition.Hyderabad, the capital city of Telangana, is renowned for its rich cultural heritage and some of the most historical places in India. Here are the details of the top 30 Temples in Hyderabad with timings.Top 30 Temples in Hyderabad1. Birla MandirBuilt entirely of white marble from Rajasthan, Birla Mandir is one of the famous temples in Hyderabad, dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, and offers a panoramic view of the city. What makes it a popular destination for both devotees and tourists? The temple’s intricate carvings and serene environment.The temple is situated on a 280-foot-high hillock called Naubat Pahad, providing a panoramic view of the city. The Hyderabad temple list is completely incomplete without this place. It is one of the best places to visit in Hyderabad.Timings: 7:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 3:00 PM – 9:00 PMLocation: Naubat Pahad, Ambedkar Colony, Khairtabad, Hyderabad, Telangana 500063Also Read: Best Time To Visit Chittoor: Know Your Favourable Season2. Chilkur Balaji TempleSource: Sahapedia”Among the famous temples in Hyderabad, this place is known as the ‘Visa Balaji Temple,’ as devotees believe that visiting this temple helps in securing a U.S. visa. With its unique tradition of circumambulating the temple 108 times, Chilkur Balaji Temple attracts thousands of visa-seeking devotees.Timings: 5:00 AM – 8:00 PMLocation: Chilkur Balaji Temple Rd, Chilkur Village, Hyderabad, Telangana 5000753. Jagannath TempleSource: Wikipedia”Have you visited the famous Puri Jagannath Temple, known for its annual Ratha Yatra, one of the interesting festivals in India in June? The temple in Hyderabad is a replica of Odisha’s temple and has a striking red sandstone architecture, which is a visual treat, while its spiritual ambience offers solace to visitors.The temple is made of red sandstone brought from Rajasthan and is also known for its annual Ratha Yatra, which attracts thousands of devotees.Timings: 6:00 AM – 11:00 AM, 5:00 PM – 9:00 PMLocation: Plot No- 1269, Road No. 12, Bhavani Nagar, Banjara Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 5000344. Sri Rama Chandra Swamy Temple, AmmapalliAmong one of the best temples in Hyderabad, this is an ancient place with a stunning gopuram and a pond believed to be over 800 years old. The temple’s peaceful environment and historical significance make it a must-visit for history enthusiasts and devotees.The temple is renowned for its unique blend of Dravidian and Rajasthani architectural styles.Timings: 6:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: 784W+V4G, Nagarguda - Shamshabad Rd, Near Rajeev Gandhi International Airport, Shamshabad, Ammapalle, Telangana 5012185. Sanghi TempleSource: Wikipedia”Located on Sanghi Hill, this temple is a popular filming location for Indian movies. It offers a beautiful view of the surroundings. The temple’s grandeur and serene environment make it a perfect spot for meditation and reflection.In the monsoon season in Hyderabad, this place offers unique festivals and puja offerings. It is one of the most famous temples in Hyderabad outskirts.Timings: 8:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Omerkhan Daira, Hyderabad, Telangana 5015116. ISKCON TempleSource: ISKCON Abids Hyderabad”Dedicated to Lord Krishna, the ISKCON Temple in Hyderabad is a vibrant place of worship known for its daily aartis and spiritual discourses. The temple’s lively atmosphere and beautiful architecture attract both devotees and tourists.The temple offers daily prasadam (sanctified food) to visitors. It is one of the amazing temples to visit in Hyderabad.Timings: 4:30 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:30 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: opp. Pulla Reddy Sweet House, Select City, Abids, Hyderabad, Telangana 5000017. Shri Ranganathaswamy TempleSource: Justdial”The temple is built in the Dravidian architectural style and is one of the few old temples in Hyderabad that reflect the grandeur of the Vijayanagara Empire.This temple is an architectural marvel with a 600-year history. It is dedicated to Lord Ranganatha (a form of Vishnu). Its intricate carvings and serene surroundings make it a significant spiritual destination.Timings: 6:00 AM – 11:30 AM, 4:00 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: Indira Nagar, Ranganatha Nagar, Imam Pura, Hyderabad, Telangana 5002648. Peddamma TempleSource: Pinterest”The temple’s name ‘Peddamma’ translates to ‘Mother of Mothers,’ and it is considered highly auspicious to visit this temple during the Bonalu festival.One of the most powerful and top temples in Hyderabad, dedicated to Goddess Peddamma, has a vibrant atmosphere and cultural significance that draws large crowds throughout the year.Timings: 6:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 3:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Road Number 55, CBI Colony, Jubilee Hills, Hyderabad, Telangana 5000339. Keesaragutta TempleSource: The Hans India”It is one of the old temples in Hyderabad, dedicated to Lord Shiva, and is believed to be where Lord Rama installed the Shiva Lingam. The temple’s historical significance and serene surroundings make it a popular pilgrimage site.The temple is surrounded by a large number of Shiva Lingams, and it is believed that there are 101 Shiva Lingams in the vicinity.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:30 PM, 3:00 PM – 7:30 PMLocation: Keesara Village, Ghatkesar, Keesaragutta, Telangana 50130110. Yadagirigutta TempleSource: India Today”Among the best temples in Hyderabad, this place is dedicated to Lord Narasimha. It is situated on a hill and attracts devotees from all over the country. Its stunning hilltop location and divine ambiance provide a spiritually enriching experience.The temple is believed to be self-manifested, and it offers multiple forms of Lord Narasimha within the sanctum. The Hyderabad temple list is incomplete without this place.Timings: 4:00 AM – 9:45 PMLocation: Yadadri Temple 1st Ghat Rd, Gandhi Nagar, Yadagirigutta, Telangana 50811511. Shree Adinath Jain TempleA beautiful Jain temple dedicated to the first Tirthankara, Adinatha, is known for its peaceful ambiance. The temple’s quiet environment and intricate architecture make it a haven for spiritual seekers.The temple’s marble carvings are highly detailed, representing the Jain principles of non-violence and peace. It is one of the top temples in Hyderabad.Timings: 6:00 AM – 8:00 PMLocation: 5-3-960, Seena Bakery Ln, Herza Estate, Malakunta, Feelkhana, Hyderabad, Telangana 50001212. Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy TempleSource: goodayzsk.shop”Located in Vinayak Nagar, this temple is known for its intricate carvings and peaceful surroundings. The temple’s divine atmosphere and beautiful sculptures attract devotees seeking tranquillity.The temple hosts several cultural and religious events, enhancing the spiritual experience for visitors. The Hyderabad temple list is incomplete without this place too.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Vinayak Nagar Community Hall, Vinayak Nagar, SPR Hills, SPR & D Hill, Yousufguda, Hyderabad, Telangana 50004513. Mahakali Temple, SecunderabadKnown for the Bonalu festival, this temple attracts thousands of devotees who come to offer their prayers to Goddess Mahakali. The temple’s lively celebrations and cultural significance make it a major spiritual centre.During important festivals, the temple is adorned with colourful decorations, and traditional dances are performed as part of the celebrations.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 9:00 PMLocation: 3-4-30 to 40, Mahankali St, General Bazaar, Kalasiguda, Secunderabad, Telangana 500003Also Read: 8 Best Food Restaurants In Hyderabad: Top Picks14. Ashtalakshmi TempleSource: Wikipedia”Dedicated to the eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi, it is one of the must visit temples in Hyderabad, known for its grand architecture and divine ambiance.The temple’s intricate design and spiritual aura draw numerous visitors. The temple celebrates Lakshmi’s eight forms, each representing different aspects of prosperity and well-being.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 9:00 PMLocation: 55 Plot, 52, W Road No. 4, Ramakrishnapuram, Kothapet, Hyderabad, Telangana 50010215. Karmanghat Hanuman TempleSource: Wikipedia”An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Hanuman, known for its powerful deity and tranquil environment. The temple’s serene surroundings and divine presence make it a popular destination for devotees.The temple is believed to have been constructed in the 12th century and has a unique tradition of offering coconuts to Lord Hanuman. It is one of the best temples to visit in Hyderabad.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:30 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: 8-2-61, Inner Ring Rd, Virat Nagar, Champapet, Hyderabad, Telangana 50007916. Shyam MandirSource: TripAdvisor”Dedicated to Lord Krishna, Shyam Mandir is a serene place of worship with beautiful idols and peaceful surroundings.The temple’s calm atmosphere and spiritual significance attract devotees seeking inner peace. The Hyderabad temple list is incomplete without this place.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: 9FQX+V2F, Kachiguda Station Rd, Veeranna Gutta, Barkatpura, Kachiguda, Hyderabad, Telangana 50002717. Sri Venkateswara Swamy Temple, HimayatnagarSource: Justdial”A popular temple dedicated to Lord Venkateswara, known for its well-maintained premises and peaceful ambiance. The temple’s spiritual aura and beautiful architecture make it a must-visit for devotees.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Liberty Rd, opp. Stanza Complex, Gagan Mahal, Domalguda, Himayatnagar, Hyderabad, Telangana 50002918. Chennakesava Swamy TempleCentre for Indic StudiesAmong the Hyderabad famous temples, this ancient temple is dedicated to Lord Vishnu and is known for its intricate carvings and serene atmosphere. The temple’s historical significance and divine ambiance attract devotees from far and wide.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: 18/9/9/41, Srisailam Hwy, Dastagirnagar, Kesav Giri, Chandrayangutta, Hyderabad, Telangana 50000519. Bhadrakali Temple, WarangalSource: Wikipedia”Located near Hyderabad, this ancient temple is dedicated to Goddess Bhadrakali and is believed to be one of the oldest temples in the region. The temple’s rich history and spiritual significance make it a major pilgrimage site.Timings: 5:30 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: XHVM+W4X, Tadkamalla Village, Warangal, Telangana 506007Suggested read: 17 Must-Visit Temples In Sivaganga For Pilgrims20. Mallikarjuna Swamy TempleSource: Times Of India”Among one of Hyderabad famous temples, this place is an ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located near Hyderabad, known for its historic significance and beautiful architecture. The temple’s stunning carvings make it a popular destination.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: 922/12, Nataraj Nagar, Asif Nagar, Hyderabad, Telangana 50002821. Sitaram Bagh TempleSource: Wikipedia”This temple is dedicated to Lord Rama and is known for its grand celebrations during the festival of Ram Navami. The temple’s vibrant atmosphere and cultural significance attract numerous devotees.Timings: 6:00 AM – 11:30 AM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Asif Nagar-Sitaram Bagh Rd, Sitaram Bagh, Hyderabad, Telangana 50000122. Arasavalli Sun TempleSource: Wikipedia”Located near Hyderabad, this ancient temple is dedicated to the Sun God and is one of the few sun temples in India. The temple’s unique architecture and spiritual significance make it a must-visit for devotees.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Arasavilli, Srikakulam, Andhra Pradesh 53200123. Sri Subramanya Swamy Temple, SkandagiriSource: Vidhaatha”Dedicated to Lord Subrahmanya, this temple is situated in a peaceful place called Padmaroa Nagar. Every Tuesday, many devotees visit this temple and seek blessings from Sri Subramanya Swamy.We can also find Lord Shiv, Ganesha, and Parvati Amma idols in the temple. A must-visit!Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 9:00 PMLocation: Skandagiri, Kanchi Kama Koti Petam, Walker Town Street No 12, behind Gandhi Hospital, Warasiguda, Padmarao Nagar, Secunderabad, Telangana 50006124. Kaleshwara Mukteswara Swamy TempleSource: Highway- WordPress.com”An ancient temple dedicated to Lord Shiva, located near Hyderabad, is known for its unique architecture and peaceful ambiance. This place represents the culture of Hyderabad.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 5:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: RW63+QR5, Gudi Rd, Kaleshwaram, Telangana 50550425. Sri Gnana Saraswathi Temple, BasarSource: Wikipedia”Dedicated to Goddess Saraswathi, this temple is a popular spot for ‘Aksharabhyasam,’ a ritual to initiate children into the world of education. The temple’s divine ambiance and cultural significance will keep you visiting the temple again and again.Timings: 6:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: Basar, Adilabad district, Telangana26. Kondagattu Anjaneya Swamy Temple:Source: Telangana Today”This temple, dedicated to Lord Hanuman, is situated on a hill and is known for its beautiful surroundings and serene atmosphere. It is one of the important temples to celebrate Ram Navami every year!Timings: 5:30 AM – 1:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: Muthyampet Rd, Karimnagar, Kondagattu, Telangana 50545227. Sri Seetharama Chandra Swamy Temple, AmmapalliSource: Youtube”The Balkampet Yellamma Temple is Hyderabad's most famous temple dedicated to the goddess Yellamma. This old temple has been an important part of the city's culture for a long time. The temple is built in a mix of traditional South Indian temple styles.Timings: 6:00 AM – 1:00 PM, 3:00 PM – 8:30 PMLocation: Balkampet Rd, BK Guda, Balkampet, Hyderabad, Telangana 50003828. Ramalayam Temple, KarmanghatThe Akkanna Madanna Mahankali Temple is a very important temple in Hyderabad's history. The temple's design shows how old the city is. People visit this ancient temple to pray and get blessings from Goddess Mahankali.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 6:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: 9F3G+MJP, Shah Ali Banda, Hari Bowli Rd, Moghalpura, Hyderabad, Telangana 50000229. Sri Lakshmi Narasimha Swamy Temple, Yadadri:Source: Justdial”Hyderabad has several temples dedicated to Jagadguru Adi Shankaracharya. These temples are peaceful places where people can think quietly and reflect. They are important temples in Hyderabad's history. It's best to visit them early in the morning.Timings: 6:00 AM – 6:00 PMLocation: 11-2-472/14, Namalagundu, Padmarao Nagar, Secunderabad, Telangana 50006130. Parnasala, Bhadrachalam:Source: Medium”This temple is believed to be the place where Lord Rama spent part of his exile and is a significant pilgrimage site for devotees. The temple’s serene surroundings and historical significance make it a must-visit for spiritual seekers.Timings: 6:00 AM – 12:00 PM, 4:00 PM – 8:00 PMLocation: WVJW+V88, Steps, Parnasala, Gogubaka Z, Telangana 507140Why should you explore Temples in Hyderabad?Exploring the famous temples in Hyderabad is like embarking on a spiritual journey through time, where each temple narrates a unique tale of devotion, architecture, and history.From the grandeur of Birla Mandir to the serene surroundings of Peddamma Temple, Hyderabad’s temples offer a perfect blend of spirituality and tranquillity.Whether you’re a devotee seeking blessings or a traveller captivated by history and architecture, the famous temples in Hyderabad outskirts promise an enriching and divine experience.Suggested Reads 11 Jun, 202427 Best Places To Visit Near Hyderabad During MonsoonEnjoy the breathtaking scenery of Ananthagiri Hills or go trekking amidst nature’s beauty at Srisailam.  Explore wildlife at Pench National Park, relax by the serene Nagarjuna Sagar dam, or indulge in monsoon treks. DestinationGeneralhyderabadTravel 27 May, 202511 Interesting Festivals In India In June 2025India’s culture shines brightly during June, offering a spectacular array of festivals.AdventureTravelFestivalsFestivalsGeneral 4 Jul, 2024Top 32 Places To Visit In Hyderabad: Unveiling The City’s Rich Heritage And Modern MarvelsHyderabad, the capital city of Telangana, is renowned for its rich cultural heritage and some of the most historical places in India .
